The maximum number of bytes to read.

member.name: M:Leadtools.LeadtoolsException.#ctor(System.String)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the LeadtoolsException class with its Exception.Message string set to *message* parameter, and its inner exception set to a null reference.
member.param: A String that describes the error. The content of message is intended to be understood by humans. The caller of this constructor is required to ensure that this string has been localized for the current system culture.

member.name: M:Leadtools.LeadtoolsException.#ctor(System.String,System.Exception)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the LeadtoolsException class with a specified error message and a reference to the inner exception that is the cause of this exception.
member.param: The error message that explains the reason for the exception.

The exception that is the cause of the current exception. If the innerException parameter is not a **null** reference, the current exception is raised in a catch block that handles the inner exception.

Width of the image in pixels.
Height of the image in pixels.
The number of bits per pixel.
Color order for 16-bit, 24-bit, 32-bit, 48-bit and 64-bit images.
Specifies where the beginning of the image is stored.

Managed data array that will contain the image data when \flags\ is RasterMemoryFlags.User.

member.name: M:Leadtools.RasterImage.AddBeziersToRegion(Leadtools.RasterRegionXForm,Leadtools.LeadPoint,Leadtools.LeadFillMode,Leadtools.RasterRegionCombineMode)
member.summary: Creates or updates the image region by adding a Bézier region.
member.param: RasterRegionXForm object that LEADTOOLS uses to translate between display coordinates and image coordinates. If you specify **null** in this parameter, the scalar fields default to 1, the offsets default to 0, and the view perspective defaults to the image view perspective.

An array of LeadPoint objects. The points in the collection must be in the order in which the vertices of the polygon are connected. To create the line that closes the polygon, the last point in the collection is connected to the first point of the collection.
Indicates how to handle complex crossing lines.
The action to take regarding the existing image region, if one is defined.

member.name: M:Leadtools.RasterImage.AddBeziersToRegion(Leadtools.RasterRegionXForm,Leadtools.RasterCollection<LeadPoint>,Leadtools.LeadFillMode,Leadtools.RasterRegionCombineMode)
member.summary: Creates or updates the image region by adding a Bézier region.
member.param: RasterRegionXForm object that LEADTOOLS uses to translate between display coordinates and image coordinates. If you specify **null** in this parameter, the scalar fields default to 1, the offsets default to 0, and the view perspective defaults to the image view perspective.

A collection of LeadPoint objects. The points in the collection must be in the order in which the vertices of the polygon are connected. To create the line that closes the polygon, the last point in the collection is connected to the first point of the collection.
Indicates how to handle complex crossing lines.
The action to take regarding the existing image region, if one is defined.

member.summary: Creates a region of pixels with values that fall within a range defined by the value of a specific pixel and a lower and upper tolerance value but are not equal to the _borderColor_.
member.param: X coordinate of a point. The color of the specified point will be used to set the region.
Y coordinate of a point. The color of the specified point will be used to set the region.
Border color.
Lower tolerance values that set the lower stopping point for the region.
Upper tolerance values that set the lower stopping point for the region.
The action to take regarding the existing image region, if one is defined.

member.name: M:Leadtools.RasterImage.AddColorHsvRangeToRegion(Leadtools.RasterHsvColor,Leadtools.RasterHsvColor,Leadtools.RasterRegionCombineMode)
member.summary: Creates or updates the image region by adding a region that consists of all the pixels that fall in the given HSV color range.
member.param: Specifies the minimum (inclusive) R, G and B values. A pixel must have H,S, and V all greater than or equal to \lowerColor\ and less than or equal to \upperColor\ to be included in the region.
Specifies the maximum (inclusive) R, G and B values. A pixel must have H,S, and V all greater than or equal to \lowerColor\ and less than or equal to \upperColor\ to be included in the region.
The action to take regarding the existing image region, if one is defined.

member.name: M:Leadtools.RasterImage.AddCurveToRegion(Leadtools.RasterRegionXForm,Leadtools.LeadPoint,System.Single,Leadtools.LeadFillMode,Leadtools.RasterRegionCombineMode)
member.summary: Creates or updates the image region by adding a curved region.
member.param: RasterRegionXForm object that LEADTOOLS uses to translate between display coordinates and image coordinates. If you specify **null** in this parameter, the scalar fields default to 1, the offsets default to 0, and the view perspective defaults to the image view perspective.

Array of LeadPoint objects. The points in the array must be in the order in which the vertices of the polygon are connected. To create the line that closes the polygon, the last point in the array is connected to the first point of the array.
A value that specifies the amount that the curve bends between control points. Values greater than 1 produce unpredictable results.
Indicates how to handle complex crossing lines.
The action to take regarding the existing image region, if one is defined.

member.name: M:Leadtools.RasterImage.AddCurveToRegion(Leadtools.RasterRegionXForm,Leadtools.RasterCollection<LeadPoint>,System.Single,Leadtools.LeadFillMode,Leadtools.RasterRegionCombineMode)

Collection of LeadPoint objects. The points in the array must be in the order in which the vertices of the polygon are connected. To create the line that closes the polygon, the last point in the array is connected to the first point of the array.
A value that specifies the amount that the curve bends between control points. Values greater than 1 produce unpredictable results.
Indicates how to handle complex crossing lines.
The action to take regarding the existing image region, if one is defined.

member.summary: Creates or updates the image region by adding a curved region.
member.param: RasterRegionXForm object that LEADTOOLS uses to translate between display coordinates and image coordinates. If you specify **null** in this parameter, the scalar fields default to 1, the offsets default to 0, and the view perspective defaults to the image view perspective.
A RasterCurve object that specifies the curve region. You specify the curve using device context coordinates, and LEADTOOLS translates the coordinates using the values specified in the \xform\.
The action to take regarding the existing image region, if one is defined.

member.name: M:Leadtools.RasterImage.GetRowColumnCompressed(System.Byte[],System.UInt16[],System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Retrieves a row (or part of a row) of 1-bit compressed data from an image that has been loaded in its compressed format.
member.param: Optional work buffer. Allocating the work buffer speeds processing if you call this method more than once, because if you do not allocate a work buffer, the method allocates and frees a temporary buffer each time it is called. The size of this buffer should be the same as the BytesPerLine property. Pass a **null** reference to \runBuffer\ if you do not want to use a work buffer.
The output buffer, which will be filled with 1-bit compressed image data. Calculate the required size of this buffer as follows: bytes required = (Width + 3) \* 2.
Index into \runBuffer\ where the get operation should start.
The number of the row to retrieve. The first row is 0, and the last row is 1 less than the image height.
The column offset within the row to retrieve. The first column offset is 0, and the last column offset is 1 less than the image width.
The number of pixels to retrieve.
member.returns: The number of pixels processed.

Allocating the work buffer speeds processing if you call this method more than once, because if you do not allocate a work buffer, the method allocates and frees a temporary buffer each time it is called. The size of this buffer should be the same as the BytesPerLine property. Pass IntPtr.Zero for \workBuffer\ if you do not want to use the work buffer
Pointer to the output unmanaged memory buffer, which will be filled with 1-bit compressed image data. Calculate the required size of this buffer as follows: bytes required = (Width + 3) \* 2.
The number of the row to retrieve. The first row is 0, and the last row is 1 less than the image height.
The column offset within the row to retrieve. The first column offset is 0, and the last column offset is 1 less than the image width.
The number of pixels to retrieve.
member.returns: The number of pixels processed.

member.name: M:Leadtools.RasterImage.GetYUVData(Leadtools.RasterYUVFormat,System.Byte[],System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Converts the RasterImage grayscale or BGR data to YUV and stores it in an output buffer.
member.param: Specifies the YUV data format.

Buffer to receive the YUV data. If NULL, this method will return the expected size of the YUV data buffer. If not NULL, the YUV data will be extracted and stored in buffer if the buffer is large enough to contain the YUV data.

Size of the data buffer pointed to by buffer. If this value is incorrect, this method will throw an exception.
member.returns: The expected size of the YUV data buffer.

member.summary: Puts one or more rows of 1-bit compressed data from a buffer into an image that is maintained in its compressed format.
member.param: Optional work buffer. Allocating the work buffer speeds processing if you call this method more than once, because if you do not allocate a work buffer, the method allocates and frees a temporary buffer each time it is called. The size of this buffer should be the same as the image's BytesPerLine property. Pass a **null** reference to \runBuffer\ if you do not want to use a work buffer.
Input buffer, which contains 1-bit compressed image data.
Offset into \runBuffer\ where the set operation should start.
Number of the first row to update.
Number of rows to update.

member.name: M:Leadtools.RasterImage.SetRowCompressed(System.IntPtr,System.IntPtr,System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Puts one or more rows of 1-bit compressed data from an unmanaged memory buffer to an image that is maintained in its compressed format.
member.param: Pointer to unmanaged memory optional work buffer. Allocating the work buffer speeds processing if you call this method more than once, because if you do not allocate a work buffer, the method allocates and frees a temporary buffer each time it is called. The size of this buffer should be the same as the image's BytesPerLine property. Pass IntPtr.Zero to \runBuffer\ if you do not want to use a work buffer.
Input buffer, which contains 1-bit compressed image data.
Number of the first row to update.
Number of rows to update.

member.name: M:Leadtools.RasterImage.WindowLevel(System.Int32,System.Int32,Leadtools.RasterColor,Leadtools.RasterWindowLevelMode)
member.summary: Sets up the paint or paint and image processing methods' window leveling options for this RasterImage
member.param: Value indicating the low bit used for leveling. 0 <= LowBit \<= HighBit <= (11 for 12-bit grayscale or 15 for 16-bit grayscale).
Value indicating the high bit used for leveling. 0 <= LowBit \<= HighBit <= (11 for 12-bit grayscale or 15 for 16-bit grayscale).

Optional 8-bit lookup table that can be used to implement a user defined conversion. For every intensity value between 0 and 2 raised to the power of (HighBit - LowBit + 1)-1 there should be a corresponding entry in the lookup table that contains a color. If \palette\ is **null**, the conversion is a normal shift (right or left) and the painted image is 8-bit grayscale. If \palette\ is not **null**, the painted image is a 24-bit image.
Value indicating whether \palette\ is used by the paint and image processing methods or only by the paint methods.

member.name: M:Leadtools.RasterImage.WindowLevelExt(System.Int32,System.Int32,Leadtools.RasterColor16,Leadtools.RasterWindowLevelMode)
member.summary: Sets up the paint or paint and image processing methods' window leveling options for this RasterImage
member.param: Value indicating the low bit used for leveling. 0 <= LowBit \<= HighBit <= (11 for 12-bit grayscale or 15 for 16-bit grayscale).
Value indicating the high bit used for leveling. 0 <= LowBit \<= HighBit <= (11 for 12-bit grayscale or 15 for 16-bit grayscale).

Optional 16-bit lookup table that can be used to implement a user defined conversion. For every intensity value between 0 and 2 raised to the power of (HighBit - LowBit + 1)-1 there should be a corresponding entry in the lookup table that contains a color. If \palette\ is **null**, the conversion is a normal shift (right or left) and the painted image is 8 or 16-bit grayscale. If \palette\ is not **null**, the painted image is a 48-bit image.
Value indicating whether \palette\ is used by the paint and image processing methods or only by the paint methods.

member.name: T:Leadtools.RasterImageAnimator
member.summary: Animates an image that has time-based frames.

member.name: M:Leadtools.RasterImageAnimator.#ctor(Leadtools.RasterImage,Leadtools.RasterImage)
member.summary: Constructs a new RasterImageAnimator object using the specified parameters.
member.param: A RasterImage object referencing the target image.

A RasterImage object containing the frames to be played. This object must be a multi-frame image (The value of RasterImage.AnimationGlobalLoop must be something other than -1. You can also pass a **null** reference (Nothing in VisualBasic) to let the method create an empty multi-frame image.

member.name: M:Leadtools.RasterImageAnimator.Append(Leadtools.RasterImage)

member.param: Image to be resized.
New width of the image data.
New height of the image data.
Output bits per pixel. Use 0 for 8-bit grayscale. Possible values are: 0, 1, 2, 3, 4, 5, 6, 7, 8, 12, 16, 24, 32, 48 and 64.
Output color order.
Flags that indicate the type of dithering, if \bitsPerPixel\ is not the same as the source image.
Flags that indicate the type of resizing.
The palette to dither to if \bitsPerPixel\ is less than or equal to 8. Pass a **null** reference to dither to the fixed palette or if no palette is required.

member.name: M:Leadtools.RasterRegion.FromBeziers(Leadtools.RasterRegionXForm,IList<LeadPoint>,Leadtools.LeadFillMode)
member.summary: Creates a Bézier region.
member.param: RasterRegionXForm object that LEADTOOLS uses to translate between display coordinates and image coordinates. If you specify **null** in this parameter, the scalar fields default to 1, the offsets default to 0, and the view perspective defaults to the image view perspective.

A collection of LeadPoint objects. The points in the collection must be in the order in which the vertices of the polygon are connected. To create the line that closes the polygon, the last point in the collection is connected to the first point of the collection.
Indicates how to handle complex crossing lines.

member.name: M:Leadtools.RasterRegion.FromCurve(Leadtools.RasterRegionXForm,IList<LeadPoint>,System.Single,Leadtools.LeadFillMode)
member.summary: Creates a curved region from a list of points.
member.param: RasterRegionXForm object that LEADTOOLS uses to translate between display coordinates and image coordinates. If you specify **null** in this parameter, the scalar fields default to 1, the offsets default to 0, and the view perspective defaults to the image view perspective.

Collection of LeadPoint objects. The points in the array must be in the order in which the vertices of the polygon are connected. To create the line that closes the polygon, the last point in the array is connected to the first point of the array.
A value that specifies the amount that the curve bends between control points. Values greater than 1 produce unpredictable results.
Indicates how to handle complex crossing lines.

member.name: M:Leadtools.RasterRegion.FromCurve(Leadtools.RasterRegionXForm,Leadtools.RasterCurve)
member.summary: Creates a curved region.
member.param: RasterRegionXForm object that LEADTOOLS uses to translate between display coordinates and image coordinates. If you specify **null** in this parameter, the scalar fields default to 1, the offsets default to 0, and the view perspective defaults to the image view perspective.
A RasterCurve object that specifies the curve region. You specify the curve using device context coordinates, and LEADTOOLS translates the coordinates using the values specified in the \xform\.

member.name: T:Leadtools.RasterRleCompressor
member.summary: Provides support for working with compressed image data buffers.

member.name: M:Leadtools.RasterRleCompressor.CompressRow(System.UInt16[],System.Byte[],System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Performs buffer-to-buffer RLE compression of 1-bit image data.
member.param: The output buffer, which will be filled with 1-bit compressed image data.
The input buffer, which contains the 1-bit image data to be compressed.
Zero-based index into \buffer\.
Column offset within the row to be processed. The method skips this many pixels before it begins processing.
The number of pixels to process.

The number of pixels to process.

member.name: T:Leadtools.RasterSupport
member.summary: The RasterSupport class provides methods for setting a LEADTOOLS runtime license and unlocking support for optional LEADTOOLS features, such as LEADTOOLS Document/Medical capabilities. For activating server licenses, see Activating Server Licenses.

member.name: M:Leadtools.RasterSupport.EnableLicenseLogging(System.Boolean,System.String)
member.summary: For internal use by LEADTOOLS.
member.param: Enable or disable logging.
Destination log file path.

member.name: M:Leadtools.RasterSupport.Initialize
member.summary: Initializes the LEADTOOLS WinRT class library for use.

member.name: M:Leadtools.RasterSupport.IsLocked(Leadtools.RasterSupportType)
member.summary: Indicates whether support is locked for an optional feature, such as LEADTOOLS Document/Medical capabilities.
member.param: Support type
member.returns: true or false

member.name: M:Leadtools.RasterSupport.ResetLicense
member.summary: Clears any LEADTOOLS runtime licenses that were previously set by calling SetLicense.

member.name: M:Leadtools.RasterSupport.SetLicense(System.Byte[],System.String)
member.summary: Sets the runtime license for LEADTOOLS and unlocks support for optional features such as LEADTOOLS Imaging Pro, Document and Medical capabilities, or PDF support. After you have obtained a runtime license and a developer key, you can call Leadtools.RasterSupport.SetLicense in your application to disable the nag message.
member.param: Byte array containing the LEADTOOLS runtime license to load.
Character string containing the developer key.

member.name: M:Leadtools.RasterSupport.SetLicense(IRandomAccessStream,System.String)
member.summary: Sets the runtime license for LEADTOOLS and unlocks support for optional features such as LEADTOOLS Imaging Pro, Document and Medical capabilities, or PDF support. After you have obtained a runtime license and a developer key, you can call Leadtools.RasterSupport.SetLicense in your application to disable the nag message.
member.param: Character string containing the developer key.

member.name: M:Leadtools.RasterSupport.SetLicense(System.IO.Stream,System.String)
member.summary: Sets the runtime license for LEADTOOLS and unlocks support for optional features such as LEADTOOLS Imaging Pro, Document and Medical capabilities, or PDF support. After you have obtained a runtime license and a developer key, you can call Leadtools.RasterSupport.SetLicense in your application to disable the nag message.
member.param: Stream containing the LEADTOOLS runtime license to load.
Character string containing the developer key.

member.name: M:Leadtools.RasterSupport.SetLicense(System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Sets the runtime license for LEADTOOLS and unlocks support for optional features such as LEADTOOLS Imaging Pro, Document and Medical capabilities, or PDF support. After you have obtained a runtime license and a developer key, you can call Leadtools.RasterSupport.SetLicense in your application to disable the nag message.
member.param: Character string containing the name of the LEADTOOLS runtime license file to load.
Character string containing the developer key.

member.name: M:Leadtools.RasterSupport.SetLicenseAsync(IRandomAccessStream,System.String)
member.summary: Sets the runtime license for LEADTOOLS and unlocks support for optional features such as LEADTOOLS Imaging Pro, Document and Medical capabilities, or PDF support. After you have obtained a runtime license and a developer key, you can call Leadtools.RasterSupport.SetLicenseAsync in your application to disable the nag message.
member.param: Character string containing the developer key.
member.returns: The asynchronous save operation object.

member.name: P:Leadtools.RasterSupport.ConfigLicenseStatus
member.summary: Gets the status of the LEADTOOLS Config License.
member.value: A RasterExceptionCode value that indicates whether a valid license is found and set. If the license is found and set it returns Success. Otherwise, it will return an error, typically **InvalidParameter**.

member.summary: The resulting region includes only the intersection of the existing region and the new one. The following example shows the result, where the rectangles represent the existing region, the ellipse represents the new one, and the shaded area represents the resulting region.

member.name: F:Leadtools.RasterRegionCombineMode.Set
member.summary: The resulting region includes only the new region. The existing region, if any, is discarded. The following example shows the result, where the ellipse is the new region and the shaded area is the resulting region.

member.name: F:Leadtools.RasterRegionCombineMode.AndNotImage
member.summary: The resulting region includes the intersection of the area outside the existing region and the area inside the new region. The following example shows the result, where the rectangle is the existing region, the ellipse is the new one, and the shaded area is the resulting region.

member.name: F:Leadtools.RasterRegionCombineMode.AndNotRegion
member.summary: The resulting region includes the intersection of the area inside the existing region and the area outside the new region. The following example shows the result, where the rectangle is the existing region, the ellipse is the new one, and the shaded area is the resulting region.

member.name: F:Leadtools.RasterRegionCombineMode.Or
member.summary: The resulting region includes the area inside the existing region and the area inside the new region. The following example shows the result, where the rectangle is the existing region, the ellipse is the new one, and the shaded area is the resulting region.

member.name: F:Leadtools.RasterRegionCombineMode.Xor
member.summary: The resulting region includes the area inside the existing region and the area inside the new region, except for any areas where the two intersect. The following example shows the result, where the rectangle is the existing region, the ellipse is the new one, and the shaded area is the resulting region.

member.name: F:Leadtools.RasterRegionCombineMode.SetNot
member.summary: The resulting region includes everything in the image, except the new region. The existing region, if any, is discarded. The following example shows the result, where the ellipse is the new region and the shaded area is the resulting region.

member.name: T:Leadtools.RasterYUVFormat
member.summary: Used with SetYUVData and GetYUVData to specify the YUV data format.

member.name: F:Leadtools.RasterYUVFormat.YV12
member.summary: Planar Y, U, V data using 4:1:1 (aka 4:2:0) subsampling. The U and V planes are half the width and height of the Y plane. The Y plane is followed immediately by the U (Cb) plane, which is followed immediately by the V (Cr) plane. The YUV data is 12 bits/pixel (each 2x2 pixels are described by 6 bytes).

member.name: F:Leadtools.RasterYUVFormat.NV12
member.summary: A Y plane followed by interleaved plane of UV data. There are half as many U and V samples as Y samples in both width and height. In other words, for each 2x2 square of Y pixels, there is only one corresponding U, V pair. The YUV data is 12 bits/pixel (each 2x2 pixels are described by 6 bytes).

member.name: F:Leadtools.RasterYUVFormat.NV21
member.summary: A Y plane followed by interleaved plane of VU data. Similar to NV12 data, except that the order of UV samples is reversed. The YUV data is 12 bits/pixel (each 2x2 pixels are described by 6 bytes).

member.name: F:Leadtools.RasterYUVFormat.YUY2
member.summary: Interleaved 4:2:2 YUYV data. Each two horizontal pixels have the same U and V values. The YUV data is 16 bits/pixel (each 2 pixels are described by 4 bytes).

A constant that determines how to open or create the file.
A constant that determines how the file can be accessed by this ILeadStream object.
A constant that determines how the file will be shared by processes.
member.returns: true if the file is opened; otherwise

member.name: M:Leadtools.ILeadStream.Read(System.Byte[],System.Int32,System.UInt32)
member.summary: Reads a specified number of bytes from the LeadStream object and writes the data into the specified buffer.
member.param: The buffer to write the data into.
Index into \buffer\ where reading begins.
The maximum number of bytes to read.
member.returns: The total number of bytes read into the buffer. The result value can be less than the number of bytes requested if the number of bytes currently available is less than the requested number, or it can be 0 (zero) if the end of the stream has been reached

member.name: T:Leadtools.RasterMemoryThreshold
member.summary: Holds the memory restrictions used when allocating new RasterImage objects.

member.name: P:Leadtools.RasterMemoryThreshold.ConventionalBuffers
member.summary: Gets or sets a value that specifies the number of buffers in conventional memory that will cache the disk tiles.
member.value: An integer value that specifies the number of buffers in conventional memory that will cache the disk tiles. Default is 1 (one swap buffer will be used to cache the disk tiles).

member.name: P:Leadtools.RasterMemoryThreshold.ConventionalTiles
member.summary: Gets or sets a value that specifies the maximum number of tiles that will reside in conventional memory at any time.
member.value: An integer value that specifies the maximum number of tiles that will reside in conventional memory at any time. Default is 0.

member.name: P:Leadtools.RasterMemoryThreshold.Empty
member.summary: Returns a new empty RasterMemoryThreshold object.
member.value: The RasterMemoryThreshold object this property creates.

member.name: P:Leadtools.RasterMemoryThreshold.MaximumConventionalSize
member.summary: Gets or sets a value that specifies the maximum size for a conventional image (default is 0x7FFFFFFF).
member.value: An integer value that specifies the maximum size for a conventional image (default is 0x7FFFFFFF).

member.name: P:Leadtools.RasterMemoryThreshold.MaximumGlobalRasterImageMemory
member.summary: Gets or sets a value that specifies the maximum size allowed for all RasterImage object allocations.
member.value: A long value that specifies the maximum size allowed for all RasterImage object allocations. The default value depends on the operating system.

member.name: P:Leadtools.RasterMemoryThreshold.TiledThreshold
member.summary: Gets or sets a value that specifies the minimum amount of free memory required to allow the allocation of conventional images.
member.value: An integer value that specifies the minimum amount of free memory required to allow the allocation of conventional images. Default value is 0.

member.name: P:Leadtools.RasterMemoryThreshold.TileSize
member.summary: Gets or sets a value that specifies the size for a size of the tile for tiled images.
member.value: An integer value that specifies the size for a size of the tile for tiled images. Default is 0
